title: So who will win the Booker prize? Margaret Atwood's The Testaments comes out on top in betting odds
text:
Next Monday night the 2019 winner of the most prestigious award in British publishing, the Booker prize, will be announced.

Selected from more than 150 entries, the author will collect £50,000 and the honour of having his or her book judged the best of the year.

Will previous winners Margaret Atwood or Salman Rushdie scoop victory, or will Lucy Ellman’s extraordinary 1,000-page, single-sentence, stream of consciousness impress the judges? Four women make the shortlist, which has proved controversial — as it does every year.

To get you in shape for the night, Stephanie Cross brings you a crib sheet to the plots and writers — and the latest odds on the winner.
description: The most prestigious award in publishing, The Booker Prize, will be handed out next Monday. Top of the odds is Margaret Atwood's sequel to the Handmaid's Tale, The Testaments.
authors: Stephanie Cross For The Daily Mail
